name: HyperlinkPageDestination
shortdesc: A hyperlink destination that is a document page.

property.name: hidden
property.shortdesc: If true, the hyperlink is hidden.

property.name: id
property.shortdesc: The unique ID of the HyperlinkPageDestination.

property.name: isValid
property.shortdesc: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent of the HyperlinkPageDestination &#40;a Document).

property.name: index
property.shortdesc: The index of the HyperlinkPageDestination within its containing object.

property.name: nameManually
property.shortdesc: If true or unspecified, allows a custom destination name; also does not update the name when the destination is moved to a different page. If false, uses the page number as the page destination name and makes the name property read-only for the destination object; also updates the name when the destination is moved to a different page.

property.name: destinationPage
property.shortdesc: The page that the hyperlink points to.

property.name: viewSetting
property.shortdesc: The destination page size when the page is reached by clicking the hyperlink.

property.name: viewBounds
property.shortdesc: The view rectangle, specified in the format [y1, x1, y2, x2]. Note: Valid only when view setting is fixed. Can return: Ordered array containing top:Unit, left:Unit, bottom:Unit, right:Unit.

property.name: viewPercentage
property.shortdesc: The zoom percentage. &#40;Range: 5 to 4000) Note: Valid only when view setting is fixed.

property.name: label
property.shortdesc: A property that can be set to any string.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.

method.name: insertLabel
method.shortdesc: Sets the label to the value associated with the specified key.

method.name: extractLabel
method.shortdesc: Gets the label value associated with the specified key.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the HyperlinkPageDestination.

method.name: getElements
method.shortdesc: Resolves the object specifier, creating an array of object references.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The registered event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
